modules.description: Loads configuration data from a string or file path, parsing key-value pairs where each key maps to a list of integer pairs representing character width information. Works with a custom type representing a collection of width-based character sets. Used to combine configuration data from multiple sources into a unified set of width rules.

Provides access to individual Unicode characters in a string via index and returns the length of the string. Operates on strings encoded with Camomile's Unicode character type. Used to process and analyze text data at the character level, such as extracting specific glyphs from multilingual strings.

Returns the column width of a Unicode character according to POSIX's wcwidth specification. Accepts Camomile.UChar.t values and returns an integer representing the width, with -1 indicating unprintable characters. Raises an exception for unprintable characters when using the width_exn variant.

Provides functions to access individual characters and determine the length of a string-like structure representing Unicode characters. Operates on a type `t` that encapsulates a sequence of Camomile UChar values. Used to efficiently retrieve characters at specific positions and determine the size of the sequence.
